Package swingtree.api

Interface Painter

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Painter
    Implement this functional interface to either paint custom styles on components by registering painters on the style API using methods like
    ComponentStyleDelegate.painter(UI.Layer, Painter) and
    ComponentStyleDelegate.painter(UI.Layer, String, Painter)
    or
    for defining custom animations by registering painters in the animation API using the AbstractDelegate.paint(AnimationState, Painter) method inside of an Animation registered through AbstractDelegate.animateFor(double, TimeUnit, Animation).

    Note that inside the painter the Graphics2D context may not be scaled according to the current UI scale factor (for high DPI displays).
    Check out the following methods for scaling you paint operations:
    • UI.scale() - returns the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(Graphics2D) - scales the given graphics context according to the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(double) - scales the given value according to the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(float) - scales the given value according to the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(int) - scales the given value according to the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(Insets) - scales the given insets according to the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(Dimension) - scales the given dimension according to the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(Rectangle) - scales the given rectangle according to the current UI scale factor.
    • UI.scale(RoundRectangle2D) - scales the given round rectangle according to the current UI scale factor.

    Also consider taking a look at the
    living swing-tree documentation where you can browse a large collection of examples demonstrating how to use the API of Swing-Tree in general.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default Painter andThen​(Painter after)
      Returns a new painter that paints this painter's style and then the given painter's style.
      static Painter none()  
      void paint​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
      Paints a custom style on a component using the given graphics context.

        default Painter andThen​(Painter after)
        Returns a new painter that paints this painter's style and then the given painter's style.
        Parameters:
        after - the painter to paint after this painter.
        Returns:
        a new painter that paints this painter's style and then the given painter's style.
